body_html:
I think for now, given that we don't really have any volunteer maintainers of this code internally, we're going to close this PR; I think the current implementation of GraphDef and state in TensorFlow's python implementation is not very amenable to analysis and correctness, and while what you've done is very neat, it will probably make it very difficult or impossible to move the existing complex python code (control flow, state management) to better implementations (not a proof, but just a gut feeling).

I believe some of the work on improving functions and state management will make something equivalent to clone() possible and maintainable, and that's what we really need to make sure we do if we intend to make our users happy.

I believe some of the work on improving functions and state management will make something equivalent to clone() possible and maintainable, and that's what we really need to make sure we do if we intend to make our users happy.
body:
I think for now, given that we don't really have any volunteer maintainers of this code internally, we're going to close this PR;  I think the current implementation of GraphDef and state in TensorFlow's python implementation is not very amenable to analysis and correctness, and while what you've done is very neat, it will probably make it very difficult or impossible to move the existing complex python code (control flow, state management) to better implementations (not a proof, but just a gut feeling).

I believe some of the work on improving functions and state management will make something equivalent to clone() possible and maintainable, and that's what we really need to make sure we do if we intend to make our users happy.
